Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
FAQs for the Pool:

  1. Pool Information
    1. The pool measures 25 yards long by 12.5 yards wide.
    2. The shallowest point is 4 feet deep and the deepest point is 16 feet deep.
    3. The pool is usually between 82-86 degrees Fahrenheit.
    4. The maximum capacity for the pool is 65 person's. 
  2. Pool Reservations are done through scheduling office at 496-3120.
    1. Scout leaders need to provide the scheduling office with information regarding the size of the group, name of the group and a contact phone number.
    2. Reservations for Scouting and Mutual groups may only be done for Tuesday evenings from 7:00p.m. to 8:30p.m. 
    3. Reservations need to be made 24 hours in advance. 
    4. Cost: 4$ per scout or swimmer, with the exception of those who have parents who work for the University.
    5.  Scouts may wear their own swimsuits in the swimming pool as long as it is in compliance with the Swim Suit Policy. 
    6. The pool can provide noodles and kick boards.
    7. If you have any questions please call the Equipment Room at (208) 496-7480. 
  3. Pool Rules:
    1. BYU-Idaho reserves the right to deny access to anyone.
    2. Do not distract the lifeguard on duty.
    3. All swimmers must take a cleansing shower before entering the pool.
    4. Do not use the pool if you have an open wound or an infectious disease.
    5. Please be courteous to other swimmers and do not spit or spout water from your mouth or blow your nose in the pool.
    6. No running or rough play allowed.
    7. No street shoes on deck.
    8. All glass containers and food are prohibited in pool area.
    9. No public display of affection.
    10. Children under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult.
    11. Pool toys are only to be used by the permissoin of the lifeguard or responsible person on duty.
    12. Use of flotation devices is restricted to children under 8 years of age who are under direct supervision of an adult.
    13. The pool must be immediately closed in cases of fecal contamination or blood release.
    14. All accidents and injuries must be reported to the lifeguard or responsible person on duty and the BYU-Idaho Safety Office.  
    15. No unsupervised use of the pool is allowed.  
    16. If you are subject to seizures or have a handicap, please notify the lifeguard before entering the pool.
  4. Diving Rules:
    1. Swimmers must be able to swim one length of the pool in order to use the diving board.
    2. Only forward motion dives, jumps or flips are permitted.
    3. Inwards, reverses and back dives are not permitted.
    4. Only one diver is permitted on the diving structure at a time.
    5. No rough play or running on the diving board.
    6. Dives or jumps must be performed straight off the board, not to the side.
    7. After diving, swimmers must clear the diving area.
    8. Lifeguards may restrict diving privileges, if they deem the use of the board to be unsafe.
  5. For information about Life Guarding and job positions please call Bertha Bowen at (208) 496-4689.
